flow.descriptionCdata:
dcd49882-8220-43e1-a1ea-59755cf663f4.04092ecc-2a3f-4d30-8be6-3321121fa02d.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults".

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
dcd49882-8220-43e1-a1ea-59755cf663f4.1a458c7b-9dde-4f28-b47f-f496f11265bc.description=Iterates through a list of values.If the list changes while running, the updates will be appended to the list. Inputs\: list - The list to iterate through. separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the list. Returns\: The current element of the list, if the response is has more Responses\: has more - Another value was in the list, and has been returned. has no more - The iterator has gone fully through the list. This response will only be returned once per iteration through the list, a subsequent call to the Iterator will restart the Iteration through the list. failure - failed to process the list. Note\: Where the iterator is in the list is tracked by each step's unique id. Therefore you can iterate on the same list from multiple steps simultaneously. WARNING\: Any step that will use the results of this Iterator operation will, by default, attempt to assign that step's inputs from a flow variable. If this is left checked, then the first element of the iterator will be used for every cycle of iteration.. dcd49882-8220-43e1-a1ea-59755cf663f4.215375b7-f7d7-4846-a621-d7d310c59482.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
dcd49882-8220-43e1-a1ea-59755cf663f4.3f1f41d4-d097-410c-a78c-d48e124aa6cf.description=
Checks to see if a string matches a specific rule.

If the matchType is RegEx, input matchTo is the regular expression like \: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. Input toMatch is the actual string to check to see if it matches the matchTo expression.

Inputs\:
matchType - The type of match to perform.
toMatch - The string to check if matches another string.
matchTo - The string to match against. 
ignoreCase - Boolean value for whether or not to ignore case during match.

Responses\:
success - The String matched.
failure - The string did not match, or something went wrong.
dcd49882-8220-43e1-a1ea-59755cf663f4.4a9f2dc7-0436-495a-bd1e-4ed39b573df1.description=
Gets the string value of an LDAP objects named property.
Creates a collection if more than one property of the same name exists.
Continue to call this same operation for all values until No More Values is returned.

Input Parameters\:
host - Name or IP address of LDAP server to query.
DN - DN of object to get property.
propertyName - Name of property to get.
username - Name of user to connect to LDAP as.
password - Password of user.
useADAuth - Add this input and set to false if using a non AD LDAP server. If false, uses ServerBind instead of secure NTLM based bind.
port - Specify the port in case it is not the default one, or it is not specified in the host path.

Responses\:
value retrieved - The value was retrieved and set as the result (returnResult).
no more values - There are no more values in the collection.
failure - failed to complete operation (one of the reasons could be port validation failure).
dcd49882-8220-43e1-a1ea-59755cf663f4.5678ce3b-0894-439f-94d5-c436dbe72b98.description=
Gets the distinguishedName of all children to an LDAP object.
Creates a collection if more than one child exists.
Continue to call this same operation for all children until No More Children is returned.

Input Parameters\:
host - Name or IP address of LDAP server to query.
port - Specify the port in case it is not specified in the host path.
DN - DN of object to get children from.
username - Name of user to connect to LDAP as.
password - Password of user.
useADAuth - Add this input and set to false if using a non AD LDAP server. If false, uses ServerBind instead of secure NTLM based bind.

Responses\:
child retrieved - The childs distinguishedName was retrieved and set as the result (returnResult)
no more children - There are no more children in the collection
failure - failed to complete operation (one of the reasons could be port validation failure)
dcd49882-8220-43e1-a1ea-59755cf663f4.79694e1a-c38b-4390-a9b7-b85d4aa1f931.description=Converts a list of numerical fields into a base 10 number. Inputs\: list - A list of numbers in the given base. delimiter - the delimiter for list. startIndex - The index to start reading the list from. Default is 0. endIndex - The index to start reading the list from. Default is end. base - The number base to convert from. Use 256 for bytes. reverse - A boolean value that reverses the list before processing it. If a list is not reversed bytes towards the end of the list are more significant than bytes towards the start. Returns\: The converted number. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. dcd49882-8220-43e1-a1ea-59755cf663f4.d425b103-def3-4144-9c56-1d1bb1e48014.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
dcd49882-8220-43e1-a1ea-59755cf663f4.description=
Converts the relative identifier (RID) to the corresponding distinguished name (DN).

Inputs\:
host - the hostname of an Active Directory domain controller
username - username for host (i.e. domain\user)
password - password for username
rid - the rid to find the distinguished name of
rootDN - the path of the top-level DN on the domain. Typically this is just the DC components of a DN (i.e. DC\=domain,DC\=com).
port - specify the port in case it is not the default one, or it is not specified in the host path.

Responses\:
success - DN retrieved
failure - something went wrong

Returns\:
The distinguished name (DN) of the object.

Note\:
The RID (relative identifier) is a 32 bit integer which uniquely identifies an object in a domain. It forms the last part of the objectSid AD property.
dcd49882-8220-43e1-a1ea-59755cf663f4.e2476b09-bb70-4063-8dd1-69f24d58221c.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
dcd49882-8220-43e1-a1ea-59755cf663f4.e76a90f2-992e-4f1f-98ca-67828fd86f7f.description=Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers or strings Inputs\: operator - The operation to perform (+ - * ^ / > < \=\= \!\= >\= <\=). value1 - the first value. value2 - the second value. Returns\: The result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true. failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
flow.name: Convert RID to DN

scriptlet.name: Step:String Comparator Flow:Convert RID to DN (3f1f41d4-d097-410c-a78c-d48e124aa6cf)
Step:LDAP Get Child Objects Flow:Convert RID to DN (5678ce3b-0894-439f-94d5-c436dbe72b98)
Step:Context Appender Flow:Convert RID to DN (04092ecc-2a3f-4d30-8be6-3321121fa02d)

staticBinding.value: The RID could not be converted to a DN.
